newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU vets Cadbury Schweppes/Coca-Cola deal.
newsitem.headline: EU vets Cadbury Schweppes/Coca-Cola deal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Wednesday it had started a routine review of a deal in which Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc acquires control of Amalgamated Beverages Great Britain Limited.

In its official journal, the European Union executive said the deal apparently fell within the scope of the EU's merger regulation, under which it checks whether mergers and other corporate deals may harm competition in the 15-nation bloc.
The Commission has one month to clear the deal or start a detailed four-month investigation. Most cases are cleared after the initial review.

Under the deal that was announced on June 4, Cadbury Schweppes Plc gets 622.5 million stg from the sale of its 51 percent stake in British bottler Coca-Cola & Schweppes Beverages Ltd (CCSB) to Coca-Cola Enterprises. Amalgamated Beverages Great Britain Ltd is the parent company of CCSB.
Under the terms of the deal CCE also signs a 15 year licensing deal to cover bottling and distribution of Cadbury Schweppes soft drinks in the UK.
